text: Saddened by the death of our colleague Girma Yeshitila, Head of Prosperity Party Amhara Region Office, who was killed by merchants of violence & enemies of tolerance. Rest in peace Comrade! My condolences to his family, friends, colleagues, the people of Amhara region & Ethiopia. https://t.co/DQcrJh18Ox
Eid Mubarak. https://t.co/T6Lqq2x87o

The role of digitalization for improving service delivery, efficiency, transparency & accountability as well as enhancing E-governance cannot be understated. Chaired Regional Science, Technology & Information Communication Council to discuss budget allocation to the initiative. https://t.co/7nZxWJWhuf

Held a productive meeting with UNICEF Ethiopia Representative Dr. Aboubacar Kampo. Appreciated UNICEF’s considerable support to people in need in Somali Region and committed to strengthen our collaboration. https://t.co/5f0IW5ulAd
Distributed Eid (Holiday) clothes to orphans in Marmarsa Boarding School in Shinile district of Siti Zone. https://t.co/5hYgR8iKbr

Inagurated 2 Projects in Sitii zone: 1) Erer Technical & Vocational Training College (which will specialize on Agriculture) & one of 5 TVET Colleges under construction in the region; and 2) Afdem Boarding School, one of 12 Boarding schools under construction in the region. https://t.co/wtB1iAyeIU
Attended the Jigjiga Grand Iftar Programme. Religious freedom is one of the reform dividends the people of the region are enjoying. https://t.co/vkWk1tMs1a
Jigjiga City Bus services started. Increasing the coverage of the services and adding more towns will be the focus from here on. https://t.co/aA65XvvoTl

The 12th Regular Somali RS Cabinet Meeting discussed & agreed on next year (2016 Eth. Calendar) budget priorities. The Cabinet was also briefed on the envisaged harmonization of national & regional security structures & endorsed the regional police reform implementation plan. https://t.co/Un109cmsSz

Pleased to welcome Oromia RS President H.E Shimeles Abdissa & his delegation to Jigjiga. Our heartfelt gratitude to Oromia for constructing a modern secondary school for Somali Reg.,with a cost of Birr 80m. It is testament to the brotherly relations b/n our two people. https://t.co/vj1CzMxDCH

While a basic truism in all times, in turbulent times, it becomes even more imperative to keep both eyes, heart & head on the ball: ball being the real issues. Those who heed this basic precept win. Those who get distracted by sideshows & red-herrings lose!

Congratulations to Abdirahman Eid, the incoming CEO of Ethiopian Investment Holding. Abdirahman was a key member of the reform team in Somali Reg. before he was promoted to deputy CEO of the EIA which he will now lead. With his energy & competence, he will excel. https://t.co/PB5mWc2YOv

Together with H.E Tagesse Chafo, the Speaker of Federal Parliament, handed over renovated houses to 31 families in Jigjiga. The joy the poor & neglected beneficiaries expressed was uplifting. Next phase, we will replicate this for 50 other families in Jigjiga; & for Zones later. https://t.co/Xyr6GZ9BKb

Concluded Mid-Year Performance Evaluation of Zonal Administrations. In addition to sustaining gains made on security, increasing revenue, enhancing accountability, timely completion of projects, & increasing production (agriculture + livestock) laid out as key areas of focus! https://t.co/hU6eaqynjZ

Inaugurated 4 projects in Wardheer town, Dollo Zone: Primary Hospital; Blood Bank; 35 km urban water supply; & 24 hr electricity. These services will transform the lives of the people of Wardheer town & Dollo Zone. https://t.co/wxGuEcJdGj

Congratulations 🎈Morocco for becoming the First African team to qualify for the Semi-Finals of the 22nd FIFA World Cup. Wish you the best in your next game and hope you reach the final. https://t.co/O69zZqE7ZK

Opened the inaugural JIGJIGA INTERNATIONAL BOOK FAIR. Encouraged by the new culture of reading & writing that is taking root in the region. Was pleased to meet young local authors & artists aspiring for greatness! Also visited the construction of Jigjiga Public Library. https://t.co/WUKXXg0kma

We lost a great national icon. A music genius. A portrait of the love, compassion, civility & tolerance Hararghe & East Ethiopia is famed for! A consummate entertainer; a voice for justice & liberation. May Allah’s mercy be on you - the legend Ali Birra. https://t.co/kYibdF3qXj

The most sustainable way of addressing impact of drought & inflation is producing what we eat. Somali Reg. Agricultural Transformation plan which has 4 pillars (lowland water mang’t, increasing production & productivity, livestock sector modernization, & marketing) is promising. https://t.co/IYlZbpvmly

Today, 620 more displaced persons are relocated as part of the durable solutions strategy. Since 2019, 78,174 HHs (453,409 persons) were returned to their place of origin while 3029 HHs (20,044 IDPs) were relocated across 13 relocation sites in 12 woredas of Somali region. https://t.co/g4HKhbKRvo

Spent the new 🇪🇹 New Year with Somali Region Special Forces & National Defense Forces at Aato border town, which was attacked by Alshabaab 2 months ago. Also laid down the foundational stone for the construction of a primary hospital in Baareey, Afdheer zone. https://t.co/KS3d57buCz

Good-hearted individuals have always inspired & transformed societies. One such individual, Mohamed Mo’alin, the founder of Marmaarsa Boarding school, deserves recognition. The school he founded 4 years ago now provides food, accommodation, education &  care to 200 orphans. https://t.co/b9dTXK0ttw

Inaugurated a 600m Birr bottled water project, owned by a private investor, in Marmarsa, Shiniile district. To date, the project provided job opportunities for over 500 people. The private sector’s contribution to the region’s economy has greatly increased in the last four years. https://t.co/8gVZjlxJMC

Prime Minister Dr. Abiy Ahmed visited the cluster farming in Tulli-Guuleed district. It is part of our region’s Agricultural Transformation Plan, which also includes livestock modernization as a pillar. https://t.co/PLbKuCYyYi

Met with representatives of the region’s women & discussed ways of further strengthening security. Immensely proud of their contributions to the peace & development in the region. https://t.co/dALL5eXGpD

With >800 killed and ~100 captured, AlShabab’s misadventure into 🇪🇹 ended with a rout of the terrorists. The task of ensuring it never dares to get close to the border is underway. https://t.co/ALSbbs3GKK

Discussed with over 1500 Somali Region Religious leaders, who later issued a statement rejecting AlShabab’s violent ideology & declared the fight against the group a religious duty. They commended the successful security operations that foiled the terrorists’s attack. https://t.co/8AUp2hoi4q

Somali Regional State parliament approved the regional government’s 2014 E.C (2021/22) Annual Performance Report; Highlighted drought response & enhanced security as key achievements; commended the foiling of AlShabaab’s attempt to export terror into the region & 🇪🇹 hinterland. https://t.co/XUROkk9E6t
Congratulations 🎈our heroes! A special thanks to the legendary Derartu Tullu who led this team with grace, humility and that distinctive smile of hers! https://t.co/h9mAPw3zfc

Guul shacabka Deegaanka Soomaalidda. Profound thanks to our people who rallied behind their heroic sons, the Somali Special Police. What a show of unity! What a clear demonstration of their love for peace & hate for terrorists! https://t.co/LECB1UKxqx

A united people & functioning state can never be intimidated by ragtag outfits like Al-Shabaab. Our gallant special forces are once again proving that the peace in the region is not at the mercy of terrorists. Lunch with the heroes who annihilated AS at Huluul, Afdheer zone. https://t.co/x9ibNQ8dE0

With Speaker of Fed. Parliament H.E Tagesse Chafo, launched the rehabilitation of houses for 30 poor families in Jigjiga. We, Somalis, have a culture of supporting each other & thus are well placed to expand this noble initiative by mobilizing businesspeople & religious elders. https://t.co/PDg9y4PHYx
Congratulations 🎈 Letesenbet and Tamirat for bringing Gold and joy to Ethiopia 🇪🇹! Congratulations Mosinet for bringing Silver. May more medals follow! https://t.co/3KRVdY3N7H
Congratulations Jigjiga University 14th Batch graduates. https://t.co/C097k9rigj

Green legacy, preservation of indigenous forests, curtailing charcoal production/export, protecting wildlife & efficient use of rural land agreed as strategic directions for the Env’tal protection, Rural Land Mang’t & Climate Change Bureau as we wind up the end-year evaluation. https://t.co/ABczC18ped

Evaluated the performance of Regional Revenue Bureau. Despite drought, the Bureau collected 7.26b this year,( ~96% of the planned 7.6b revenue). In the last 4 yrs, revenue collected is 18.6b Vs 10.6b in the preceding 10 yrs. Shows marked improvement in tax collection capacity. https://t.co/hBwQ0bIO8N

Together with Commissioner General Demelash G/Mikael, attended the graduation ceremony of >2100 Fed. & Reg. Police graduates, trained at Jigjiga Police Academy. The Somali contingent of today’s graduates, 400, will be deployed as Jigjiga police to enhance the capital’s security. https://t.co/3fjdhPAT1U

Fighters yesterday, peace-preachers today. Pleased to welcome leaders of the Ogaden National Liberation Front (ONLF) who paid a courtesy call on me, on the occasion of Eid Al Adha. They include two members of the current Regional Cabinet. https://t.co/1BtdSeR0z9
Eid Mubarak to all Muslim brothers and sisters. https://t.co/h64fAyoe9X

Held a very productive meeting with the head of IOM Regional Director and discussed ways of providing lasting solutions to the large number of displaced people in Somali Region. On a personal note, it was an honor and privilege to welcome a highly valued brother.@AbdikerM https://t.co/iiVN7ARxT3

Peace dividend! Passion for sports is a new uplifting culture of our youth. Congratulations Jarar Lions for winning the Zonal Football competition of Somali Region for the 2nd time in three years. https://t.co/SrUxAMm19m

In addition to the expansion of Jigjiga electricity supply by 3-fold from where it was for 20 years, (i.e.,from 12mva to 31.5mva), 58 urban centers including the capitals of 18 Districts in the region got 24 hour power supply in the last 4 years! #progress! https://t.co/O4lbqsnl2B

Encouraged by the rising number of Somali Region intellectuals complementing our famed oral tradition with writing! Received Professor Abdirisak Warfa’s “Cries in the Hinterland” chronicling “untold stories” of pain & suffering in Somali Region from 1948 to 2018. https://t.co/0kt1hUyeaa

Opened a High-level Forum on Combating Contraband Activities. Recent coordinated effort by Federal & Regional stakeholders is bearing fruits & needs to be redoubled. The forum identified key problems and proposed solutions. https://t.co/eQPq6cCgZs

How can one reconcile the Iftars at the palace, street Iftar in Addis’s main squares, the first International Quran competition in Addis Ababa, all taking place ONLY in PM Abiy Ahmed’s reign & for the first time in 🇪🇹 history, with the headline on FP below? https://t.co/ngJWNS4RbW

By committing more resources, Somali Region intends to produce 28m quintals of cereals this year (>100% increase from last year) and agricultural mechanization is key to achieve this target. 168 new tractors purchased for this purpose are launched today. https://t.co/sdEz4AxmRM

In Godey town, Discussed with a high-level delegation led by the Exe. Dir. of WFP H.E David Beasley & Swedish Minsiter of Int’l
Dev’t Coop H.E Matilda Ernkrans on ways of supporting food production & water management systems to enhance food security in a more sustainable manner. https://t.co/dmZUJLL6Oy

Met with WFP Representative & Country Director for Ethiopia H.E Claude Jibidar & discussed ways of enhancing food security response activities for people in need of humanitarian assistance in Somali Region. https://t.co/AjZVGdBFHe

Congratulations to the new Pres. of Somalia H.E Hassan Sheikh Mohamud. I wish him success in his endeavors. I would also like to acknowledge & thank former President H.E Mohamed Abdullahi Farmaajo for his role in strengthening the brotherly relations b/n 🇸🇴 & 🇪🇹.

This is Kebridahar University, which three years ago was a barren, dusty place. Shows what can be achieved with dedication and hard work. The University Management Team deserves appreciation. https://t.co/qZdOKygdlS

Met UNICEF Executive Director Ms. Catherine Russell & expressed the regional govt’s gratitude for the critical role unicef continues to play in responding to humanitarian/dev’t needs in the region, mainly its support on water, nutrition, health & education. @UNICEFEthiopia https://t.co/gUh8iysqQc

Had a very productive meeting with the US Ambassador to Ethiopia Amb.Tracy Ann Jacobson who is visiting drought-affected people in the region. We thank the US government, who through USAID, has been a key partner in drought response efforts & look forward for more collaboration. https://t.co/I72L2AWr7b

Listened to a businesswoman & a businessman who lost ~$1/2million in Hargeisa fire last night. The remarkable equanimity with which they took their loss exemplify the resilience of the people of Somaliland. Like the phoenix, they rose from the ashes before; they will do it again!

With efforts to prevent drought in the region into turning to famine successful, building the resilience of communities is the next major task. We signed a letter of intent towards this goal with UN Hum/Res. Coordinator Dr. Catherine Sozy &UNDP 🇪🇹 Res. Rep. Mr. Turhan Saleh. https://t.co/0gF2xAtW6w

With Deputy President of the ruling party, 4 Executive Committee members and 23 Central Committee members in the party, 3 Ministers and 3 Deputy Ministers, our “claiming the center” politics is paying off! We are now the mainstream. We are the center! https://t.co/lMIkju4gCA

Congratulations to H.E Prime Minister Dr. Abiy Ahmed for being elected the President of Prosperity Party in the party’s historic inaugural Congress. Congratulations to H.E Adan Farah and H.E Demeke Mekonnen, the elected Deputy Presidents of the party. https://t.co/i27TWU6ZhP

The Somali people in 🇪🇹 have today lived to see their son elected as the deputy president of the ruling Prosperity Party. Unthinkable just years back when Somalis were branded unfit to comprehend “revolutionary democracy”! Congratulations brother Adan Farah. We are at the center! https://t.co/DdRhnU5qKO
* Sudan grass… not Sugan grass

As part of drought response, planting/harvesting of sugan grass (animal feed) is underway, using river water. The pictures are in Gode (Shabelle zone) and Hudet (Dawa zone). The production of animal feed played a crucial role in saving animals. https://t.co/rTAPQFe0q2

Visited the remote districts of Salahad (Erer zone) & Harareey (Nogob zone) to oversee ongoing drought response activities. Very pleased with the significant response provided so far which stabilized the situation, but more needs to be done in the coming weeks. https://t.co/ZpFqLXjY1Z

Approved an additional 41 million Birr for animal feed and protection (women & girls) in today’s regional drought committee meeting. The allocation is made to cover gaps identified by the sectors. https://t.co/e2yFjLeBVC

Welcomed a Fed. Gov’t delegation led by https://t.co/CGP7jo5egd & Foreign Min. H.E Demeke Mekonnen to Jigjiga & discussed drought response. We thank the Min. of Revenue & Customs Commission for providing 31.4m Birr worth of assistance (cash & in-kind) to drought-affected people. https://t.co/8E6Ha3NtcU

Once again, we profoundly thank Addis Ababa City Council & Mayor Adanech Abiebie for providing 22 trucks of feed & food to people affected by drought in Somali region. This is the 2nd assistance the admin. has extended to us after the initial 100m worth of in-kind contributions. https://t.co/fXrwoStY6q

Received a joint delegation led by Federal Minister of Health Dr. Liya Tadesse, and accompanied by officials from the Ministry of Agriculture, WHO and FAO. We appreciate the support the two Ministries and two UN agencies provided as part of drought response efforts in our region. https://t.co/FgfuDAf3Sr

In addition to approving the gov’ts 6-month performance report, Som Reg. Parliament passed historic proclamations re revenue, asset registration of public officials & civil servants, & judicial administration in its 2nd regular session. It returned 3 proclamations for review. https://t.co/psGYSjqepz
Indeed a new era. Would not have been possible without the dedication, commitment and innovative ideas of the new reformist leadership. https://t.co/dBL5b7hqhM

The 2nd session of the 6th Parliament of Somali Regional State is underway. Presented the Government’s 6 month Performance Report,which mainly focused on drought response & progress on ongoing development projects. Regional elders invited as guests for the first time. https://t.co/s1KmFLxnby

Many thanks to Sidama R/S & its President H.E Desta Ledamo who donated 20m Birr to Somalis affected by drought. Sidama region, established very recently, has demonstrated exemplary generosity that attests to the brotherly & historical bond b/n the peoples of the two regions. https://t.co/GGZ2m3Qa32

In today’s Regional Cabinet Meeting, we approved an additional 500 million Birr to scale-up drought response activities with focus on food, water, health, fodder and veterinary drugs. 100 additional water trucks are also being dispatched to affected districts. https://t.co/P5E0SsmLRY

Inaugurated the Hartasheekh-Harshin gravel road, constructed with a budget of 155 million Birr. The people in Harshin district used to be cut off from the neighboring towns and Jigjiga during the rainy season. https://t.co/DU4OJdIfoo

Unconditional Cash transfers are one modality of increasing access to food and is underway in districts affected by drought. The plan is to add more beneficiaries to existing caseload soon. https://t.co/OiK9sXy2aU
Honored to welcome Sheikh Mohamed Abdi Umal, representing Somali religious leaders, who came to Jigjiga to assess the needs of people affected by the drought in Somali Region. https://t.co/jHSnlUs0SM

Heartfelt thanks to Oromia President H.E Shimeles Abdissa & gov’t of Oromia who provided 50m Birr to drought-affected Somalis. At a time Oromia is struggling with similar droughts, their support to our region is a reminder of the brotherly bond b/n the peoples of the two regions. https://t.co/MX7l1jaIgK

The scale and severity of the drought in Somali Region is increasing by the day and scaling-up the ongoing humanitarian response is critical to prevent further deterioration. Spoke to BBC Focus on Africa to highlight the situaiton and the need for more assistance. https://t.co/jczZGgjdqh

Met with ICRC Head of Delegation for Ethiopia Mr. Nicolas Von Arx to discuss collaboration on drought response. Particularly pleased to hear that ICRC is implementing a livestock vaccination & animal feed project in the remote districts of Lagahida, Qubi and Mayamuluqo. https://t.co/7bKG5FOsKO

Discussed drought situation, response and gaps with USAID Ethiopia Head, Mr. Sean Jones. We appreciate USAID’s continued humanitarian and development assistance and count on more support at this critical time. https://t.co/wRaIEZN3aG

Briefied a delegation led by H.E Amb.Sahlework Zewde, President of #Ethiopia & Dep.Secretary General of the #UN H.E Amina Mohammed on the drought situation. Agreed to scale-up ongoing response while also giving due attention to mitigating the underlying causes of vulnerability. https://t.co/0RtUETABmT

It is better to assist people in their areas of origin! Our Zonal administrators in Liban Zone assisted 760 refugee households who are in dire situation in Dollo-Ado; but more crossings from Somalia will put pressure on already stretched response capacity and basic services. https://t.co/dsZFsDocSC

As Somali Region grabbels with drought, the crossing of refugees from Somalia in the southern zones of the region is posing major challenge. #UNHCR must establish a reception center in Dollo, Somalia to prevent more people crossing the international border and becoming refugees.

In addition to safeguarding peace and security in the region, Somali Region Special Forces are also actively taking part in assisting people affected by drought. We applaud the exemplary work they are doing for their people. https://t.co/xiRkX76fGb

2) Given the serious humanitarian in Amhara region following the TPLF aggression, their decision to support the drought-affected Somali people is a gesture of generosity, which is an example of the brotherly cooperation between the peoples of the two regions in the post-TPLF era. https://t.co/M8tIWWuoUk

1)Profound thanks & gratitude to the Amhara Regional State and its President H.E Dr. Yilikal Kefale for supporting drought response activities in somali region through the provision of trucks of animal feed. https://t.co/h9jEhGqYYp

Briefied a delegation led by the UN Regional Humanitarian Coordinator for East Africa Mr. Daniel Endries on the drought situation in Somali region. We agreed on the immediate need for scaling up ongoing response activities & importance of timely response as the needs are huge. https://t.co/9troyfHgvi

Unveiled newly established Shabelle Bank, the first Somali-owned bank in Ethiopia. Its success hinges on the committment of the owners, the competency of its management, & the support of the public. When it realizes its potential, it will transform the lives of the population. https://t.co/h6Zj7joqwj

Gone are the days when blockades & media blackouts were used to hide disasters. #Somali_Reg is open for all national & international media & humanitarian organizations (who already have strong presence). We not only invite, we encourage them to come & see the situation.

The story about Somali Region is not only about drought. Significant progress is also made on the development front in the last 3 years. The Prime Minister visited some of the newly constructed Jigjiga asphalt roads. https://t.co/eVcPVhouJD

Was pleased to welcome former Dep. Pres. of the Somali Reg. State & current Head of PP Head Office Adan Farah to Jigjiga. To say he played a crucial role in rebuilding & reforming the dismantled government institutions, as a pillar of the reform team, is an understatement. https://t.co/vyCwXydSML

Welcomed Prime Minister H.E. Dr. Abiy Ahmed who arrived in Jigjiga to review relief activities. The PM pledged to support response efforts and to scale-up lowland water management schemes, including the construction of dams to harvest rainwater to reduce vulnerability. https://t.co/3Cn6pRJ8Zd

Discussed the drought situation in the Somali Region with World Food Programme (WFP) Regional Director for Eastern Africa Mr. Michael Dunford. I stressed the importance of scaling-up food assistance to affected people to prevent malnutrition and save lives. https://t.co/wdiB1newaq

We thank the people and government of Southern Ethiopia Region & President Ristu Yirdaw for providing 20 million Birr (15m cash + 5m in-kind) to the drought affected people in Somali Region. It is an example of brotherly compassion between members of the Ethiopian federation. https://t.co/U9TTX2ul5q

Many thanks to our brothers Harari Regional State and President Ordin Badri for contributing 11 million Birr (10 million cash and 1 million in-kind) to drought-affected people in Somali Region. It is a timely support which attests to the historical brotherhood of the two people. https://t.co/Z6yhgB9FgX

On behalf of the gov’t and people of Somali Region, we profoundly thank the Addis Ababa City Adminstration and Mayor Adanech Abiebie for providing food items worth Birr 100 million to drought-affected people in the region. We appreciate this act of brotherhood and empathy. https://t.co/EFbb5MtMft

Gov’t & party senior leadership discussed current nat’l & reg’l political & security situation as well as drought response. The importance of #regional_dialogue to build consensus on common aspirations as a preparation for the envisaged national dialogue was agreed on. https://t.co/fazykLQ7zB

Discussed drought response with #Unicef interim Ethiopia Representative Gianfranco Rotigliano. Unicef is providing support in the areas of water & sanitation, nutrition, education in emergency, and child protection. https://t.co/PWiHosiFbM
Our gratitude and thanks to Diredawa City Council and Mayor Kedir Juhar for providing 10 million Birr to support drought response activities in Somali Region. https://t.co/O7PbnJpdCd

Congratulations to brother Hamse Warfa for being appointed by the President of the United States as a Senior Advisor to the State Department on democracy and human rights. Keep shining! https://t.co/Y2B5swZaLr

Planting trees today prevents tomorrow’s drought. Participated in the planting of trees on newly constructed Jigjiga asphalt roads. Mitigating impact of climate change & reducing community’s vulnerability and dependency on aid are high on the agenda of the regional government. https://t.co/Sv627Zut6R

While responding to the drought in the region, the regional gov’t is also giving due attention to the attainment of set development goals. Today, I inaugurated Dhagahle Secondary School, one of 89 Secondary Schools built by the regional government in the last 3 years. https://t.co/qvGQCBtTWd
